answerText: benzene[10] As a planar conjugated ring, benzene exhibits this property, in which it is stabilized by the delocalization of electrons. Contrary to the name, it doesn't have much to do with smell.

question: Question: August Kekul√© proposed a structure of this compound with alternating single and double bonds.  [10] Name this compound with chemical formula C6H6, comprising six carbon atoms in a ring with one hydrogen atom attached to each.
